verses.kjv: And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the inhabitants of Gilead, said unto Ahab, As the LORD God of Israel liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.
verses.web: Elijah the Tishbite, who was one of the settlers of Gilead, said to Ahab, “As LORD, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.”
verses.ct: Elijah the Tishbite, a settler from Gilead, went to King Ahab and declared, "As surely as the LORD, the God of Israel, lives — the God I serve — there will be no dew or rain in the coming years unless I say so."

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto him, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to him, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Elijah:

verses.kjv: Get thee hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
verses.web: “Go away from here, turn eastward, and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.
verses.ct: "Leave this place. Head east and hide by the brook Cherith, east of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
verses.web: You shall drink from the brook. I have commanded the ravens to feed you there.”
verses.ct: You'll drink from the brook, and I've commanded ravens to bring you food there."

verses.kjv: So he went and did according unto the word of the LORD: for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
verses.web: So he went and did according to LORD’s word; for he went and lived by the brook Cherith that is before the Jordan.
verses.ct: Elijah did exactly what the LORD told him. He went and stayed by the brook Cherith, east of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.
verses.web: The ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening; and he drank from the brook.
verses.ct: Every morning and every evening, the ravens brought him bread and meat, and he drank water from the brook.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land.
verses.web: After a while, the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.
verses.ct: But after some time, the brook dried up because there had been no rain anywhere in the land.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto him, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to him, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to him again:

verses.kjv: Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongeth to Zidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow woman there to sustain thee.
verses.web: “Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and stay there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain you.”
verses.ct: "Get up and go to Zarephath, a town near Sidon, and stay there. I've already told a widow in that town to provide for you."

verses.kjv: So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, the widow woman was there gathering of sticks: and he called to her, and said, Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.
verses.web: So he arose and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks. He called to her, and said, “Please get me a little water in a jar, that I may drink.”
verses.ct: So Elijah got up and traveled to Zarephath. When he arrived at the town gate, he saw a widow gathering sticks. He called out to her, "Please, could you bring me a little water in a jar so I can have a drink?"

verses.kjv: And as she was going to fetch it, he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thine hand.
verses.web: As she was going to get it, he called to her, and said, “Please bring me a morsel of bread in your hand.”
verses.ct: As she turned to go get it, he called after her, "And please bring me a small piece of bread too."

verses.kjv: And she said, As the LORD thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but an handful of meal in a barrel, and a little oil in a cruse: and, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.
verses.web: She said, “As LORD your God lives, I don’t have a cake, but a handful of meal in a jar, and a little oil in a jar. Behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and bake it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.”
verses.ct: She stopped and said, "As surely as the LORD your God lives, I don't have any bread — just a handful of flour in a jar and a tiny bit of oil in a jug. I'm out here gathering a couple of sticks so I can go home and make one last meal for my son and me. After we eat it, we'll starve to death."

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto her, Fear not; go and do as thou hast said: but make me thereof a little cake first, and bring it unto me, and after make for thee and for thy son.
verses.web: Elijah said to her, “Don’t be afraid. Go and do as you have said; but make me a little cake from it first, and bring it out to me, and afterward make some for you and for your son.
verses.ct: Elijah told her, "Don't be afraid. Go ahead and do what you planned, but first make a small loaf for me and bring it out. After that, make something for yourself and your son.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD God of Israel, The barrel of meal shall not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the LORD sendeth rain upon the earth.
verses.web: For LORD, the God of Israel says, ‘The jar of meal will not run out, and the jar of oil will not fail, until the day that LORD sends rain on the earth.’ ”
verses.ct: Because this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'The jar of flour will not run out, and the jug of oil will not run dry, until the day the LORD sends rain on the land again.'"

verses.kjv: And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, did eat many days.
verses.web: She went and did according to the saying of Elijah; and she, and he, and her house, ate many days.
verses.ct: She went and did what Elijah asked. And sure enough, she, Elijah, and her household had food to eat for many days.

verses.kjv: And the barrel of meal wasted not, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by Elijah.
verses.web: The jar of meal didn’t run out, and the jar of oil didn’t fail, according to LORD’s word, which he spoke by Elijah.
verses.ct: The jar of flour never ran out, and the jug of oil never ran dry — just as the LORD had promised through Elijah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him.
verses.web: After these things, the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, became sick; and his sickness was so severe that there was no breath left in him.
verses.ct: Sometime later, the son of the woman who owned the house became sick. His illness grew worse and worse until finally he stopped breathing.

verses.kjv: And she said unto Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembrance, and to slay my son?
verses.web: She said to Elijah, “What have I to do with you, you man of God? You have come to me to bring my sin to memory, and to kill my son!”
verses.ct: The woman cried out to Elijah, "What have you done to me, man of God? Did you come here to remind God of my sin and kill my son?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into a loft, where he abode, and laid him upon his own bed.
verses.web: He said to her, “Give me your son.” He took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into the room where he stayed, and laid him on his own bed.
verses.ct: Elijah said to her, "Give me your son." He took the boy from her arms, carried him upstairs to the room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed.

verses.kjv: And he cried unto the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, hast thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slaying her son?
verses.web: He cried to LORD, and said, “LORD my God, have you also brought evil on the widow with whom I am staying, by killing her son?”
verses.ct: Then he cried out to the LORD, "LORD my God, have you brought tragedy even on this widow who has taken me in, by letting her son die?"

verses.kjv: And he stretched himself upon the child three times, and cried unto the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, I pray thee, let this child’s soul come into him again.
verses.web: He stretched himself on the child three times, and cried to LORD, and said, “LORD my God, please let this child’s soul come into him again.”
verses.ct: He stretched his body over the child 3 times and cried out to the LORD, "LORD my God, please let this child's soul return to him!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
verses.web: LORD listened to the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
verses.ct: The LORD heard Elijah's prayer. The child's soul came back into him, and he came back to life.

verses.kjv: And Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the chamber into the house, and delivered him unto his mother: and Elijah said, See, thy son liveth.
verses.web: Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the room into the house, and delivered him to his mother; and Elijah said, “Behold, your son lives.”
verses.ct: Elijah picked up the boy, carried him downstairs from the upper room, and placed him in his mother's arms. "Look," Elijah said, "your son is alive!"

verses.kjv: And the woman said to Elijah, Now by this I know that thou art a man of God, and that the word of the LORD in thy mouth is truth.
verses.web: The woman said to Elijah, “Now I know that you are a man of God, and that LORD’s word in your mouth is truth.”
verses.ct: The woman said to Elijah, "Now I know for certain that you truly are a man of God, and that every word the LORD speaks through you is truth."
